meanings.definition: To assume a particular attitude or pose, especially in a theatrical or affected manner.
meanings.sent1: She was attitudinising in front of the mirror, pretending to be a famous actress.
meanings.sent2: The politician was attitudinising during the speech, trying to appear confident.
meanings.sent3: The cat was attitudinising by walking with its tail held high, as if it owned the place.
meanings.sent4: The student was attitudinising like a seasoned performer, trying to impress the audience.
meanings.sent5: Her attitudinising on stage was so exaggerated that it made everyone laugh.

meanings.definition: To adopt a pretentious or affected attitude or behavior.
meanings.sent1: He was attitudinising at the party, pretending to be someone he's not.
meanings.sent2: She was attitudinising by speaking in a fake accent to seem more sophisticated.
meanings.sent3: The toddler was attitudinising by wearing oversized sunglasses indoors.
meanings.sent4: The model was attitudinising on the runway, trying to appear more glamorous.
meanings.sent5: His attitudinising at work was so obvious that nobody took him seriously.
